error.userNotFound: The username or password you entered is incorrect.
error.invalidStructure:
The password you entered has an invalid structure.
Passwords must obey the following rules:
- Must be of length between 8 and 14.
- Must not contain your name.
- Must contain at least one lowercase letter (a-z).
- Must contain at least one digit (0-9).
- Must contain at least one of the following symbols: %~!@#\$^*=+?[]{}.
- Must not contain the following characters: < or >

itunes.title: iTunes Parameters

landingPage.label: Landing page
landingPage.explanation: Enter the URL template that you would like to appear in the iTunes Store Podcast for each video in this feed. The system will append the specific entry id for each entry. For example:"http://mysite.com?videoid="

itunes.enforceFeedAuthor: Use this name as the Episode Author for all episodes

adultContent.label: Adult Content
adultContent.hint: If you populate this tag with 'Yes', an 'explicit' parental advisory graphic will appear next to your podcast artwork on the iTunes Store and in the Name column in iTunes. If the value is 'Clean', the parental advisory type is considered Clean, meaning that no explicit language or adult content is included anywhere in the episodes and a clean graphic will appear. If the explicit tag is present and has any other value(e.g 'No') you see no indicator - blank is the default advisory type.

entitlements.title: Entitlements
entitlements.description: Manage your entitlements settings and specific end-user permissions to content in your applications.

privacyContentLabel.label: Privacy Context Label
privacyContentLabel.help:
To enable access to content in this category from the application and enforce its entitlement rules, the Privacy Context Label MUST be set as part of the application session (KS) privileges. 

This label is set as part of the MediaSpace installation/upgrade process. For any other purposes set/edit the Privacy Context Label from the Integration Settings page under the Settings tab.

manageUsersPermissionsEditMessage.title: Error
manageUsersPermissionsEditMessage.description: You must save the category before setting its user permissions.

contentPrivacy.label: Content Privacy
contentPrivacy.help:
The Content Privacy option that you select will define the visibility of content in this category, including its related metadata. This setting will apply to the application's content search results, content lists or specific content item retrieved.

For content associated with more than one category, the privacy will be determined based on the category with the lowest restriction level.

Additional playback restrictions may apply through each entry's access control settings.
contentPrivacy.noRestrictions_explanation: Visible to everyone with access to the application page,
contentPrivacy.requiresAuthentication_explanation: Visible only to authenticated end users,
contentPrivacy.private_explanation: Category is visible only to users with specific permissions to access this category content.

categoryListing.label: Category Listing
categoryListing.help: The Category Listing option that you select will define who can see this category's name and metadata in the application's category menus and  listing.
categoryListing.noRestrictions_explanation: Visible to everyone with access to the application page.
categoryListing.private_explanation: Category is visible only to users with specific permissions to access this category content.

contentPublishPermissions.label: Content Publish Permissions
contentPublishPermissions.help: Which end-users can add content to this category through your applications?
contentPublishPermissions.private_explanation: Only end-users with specific permission can add content to this category.

moderateContent.label: Moderate Content
moderateContent.help: Media will not appear in page until approved by the category manager/moderator.

accountInfo.title: Account Info
accountInfo.helpText:
The Privacy Context Label of each category defined here will automatically be applied to its sub categories.
The same label should be set as part of the application's session (KS) privileges.

errors.loadFailed: An error occurred during account info loading.

entitlement.title: Entitlement
entitlement.explanation: To add Entitlement Settings for categories, click ‘Add Entitlement’.

addEntitlement.title: Add Entitlement
addEntitlement.explanation: Select the root category integrated with your application and label it below.
addEntitlement.confirmation:
Entitlement settings will be added to all sub-categories in an asynchronous process. This operation may take a few minutes.

Note: This action may impact access to content in the selected category through existing applications that were not updated to work with the Kaltura entitlement services.

Are you sure you want to continue?

errors.requiredPrivacyContextLabel: You must enter a Privacy Context Label.

deleteEntitlement.title: Delete Entitlement
deleteEntitlement.confirmation:
Entitlement settings will be removed from all sub-categories in an asynchronous process. This operation may take a few minutes. 

Note: Any previous Content Privacy settings defined for the {{0}} category (including all sub-categories) will be lost.

Are you sure you want to continue?

errors.passwordStructure:
The password you entered has an invalid structure.
Passwords must obey the following rules :
- Must be of length between 8 and 14.
- Must not contain your name
- Must contain at least one lowercase letter (a-z).
- Must contain at least one digit (0-9).
- Must contain at least one of the following symbols:  %%~!@#$^*=+?[]{}.
- Must not contain the following characters: < or >.
